title: Launch event R-Ladies Den Bosch
description:
Launch event R-Ladies Den Bosch

We are very excited to invite you to our Launch Event on September 11!
During our Launch event, we will give an introduction to R-Ladies, the JADS (the Jheronimus Academy of Data Science, our host), and we would love to get to know you!

As a local R-Ladies chapter, we want to host accessible workshops and create a community of R-enthusiasts where everyone can develop their R skills. Everyone who is interested in the R language and supports inclusion in the community is welcome to join.

If you haven’t done so already, please fill out our Launch questionnaire (https://forms.gle/hRkiLps4se3rPeby7). We will present the results of the questionnaire during our Launch event. Even if you can’t make it to our Launch Event, we would love to hear your input!

A huge thank you to JADS for hosting us!
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

SCHEDULE
17:30 Doors open
18:00 Intro to R-Ladies, by Veerle
18:10 A word from our host this evening, JADS, by Lieke
18:20 Key-note speech, tba
18:45 Break
19:00 Presentation of survey results, by Martine
19:20 Nearest Neighbour game
19:45 Wrap-up
20:00 Drinks and networking in Bolwerk Sint-Jan

CODE OF CONDUCT
Please take a minute to read our code of conduct -- we are committed to creating a safe and harassment-free environment
https://github.com/rladies/starter-kit/wiki/Code-of-Conduct

Looking forward to meeting all of you!
-- Organizing team R-Ladies Den Bosch

venues.name: Universiteit Jheronimus Academy of Data Science

title: Evaluation - Chp 20 Advanced R - R Ladies Netherlands Boook Club
description:
Pavitra Chakravarty will take us through the key points of Evaluation, (chapter 20 of Advanced R by Hadley Wickham, https://adv-r.hadley.nz/).

The link to the event meeting is now known.

See you soon!

title: R Ladies Netherlands Boook Club - Advanced R - Chapters 15/16: S4/Trade-offs
description:
The R Ladies chapters of the Netherlands are partnering up!

Starting in April, we are hosting an online book club. Our first book is Hadley Wickham's Advanced R (https://adv-r.hadley.nz/).

In this meeting, Martine Jansen from R Ladies Den Bosch will present the key points of Chapter 15 : "S4" and Chapter 16: 'Trade-offs". After that, we'll try an exercise together and help each other clear up any doubts and get over any hurdles :)

The link to the event meeting will be provided closer to the date.

Online meetings will take place every two weeks. Check the full schedule, previous slides and sign up to present a chapter (would be so nice) at this link https://rladiesnl.github.io/book_club/ !

See you soon!

title: **NEW DATE** R Markdown – Composing Reproducible Documents with Graphs & Tables
description:
We are excited to invite you to our first event of 2020!
During this event, Martine Jansen will give a workshop on R Markdown. R Markdown provides a way to integrate code and report content into high quality documents. R Markdown documents are fully reproducible and support dozens of output formats. In this workshop we will create an R Markdown document, in which we use the tidyverse to read a csv and manipulate it. After adding some analyses and plots, we will write inline R code, so the text in the report changes depending on the data. We present the resulting analysis with one click in a nicely formatted Word document. After this workshop you will have the tools to start your own analysis projects with RStudio.

Martine Jansen works for Fontys University of Applied Sciences as an institutional researcher. Another form of this workshop was presented at the EAIR forum 2019 in Leiden and at R-Ladies Amsterdam.

**PLEASE NOTE THE CHANGED DATE**

Date: Tuesday, February 18th, 2020
Starting time: 6PM
Location: Avans Hogeschool Den Bosch (walking distance from train station)

As a local R-Ladies chapter, we want to host accessible workshops and create a community of R-enthusiasts where everyone can develop their R skills. Everyone who is interested in the R language and supports inclusion in the community is welcome to join.

CODE OF CONDUCT
Please take a minute to read our code of conduct -- we are committed to creating a safe and harassment-free environment
https://github.com/rladies/starter-kit/wiki/Code-of-Conduct

Looking forward to meeting all of you!
-- Organizing team R-Ladies Den Bosch

title: R-Ladies+ feat. useR! meetup
description:
This year useR! (https://user2021.r-project.org/) will be a global and entirely remote conference. One of the main goals is to encourage the participation of diverse people (considering diversity in all its forms and all its intersectionalities). The useR! global team is committed to providing inclusive and accessible spaces during the conference, along with extensive waivers, events in different languages (English, Spanish, and French), real-time English captions, and events across different time zones.

In this meetup, you will have the opportunity to meet R-Ladies+ from all over the globe. Our panelists will share their useR! experiences to inspire people with different backgrounds, occupations, and paths to participate in this year’s conference. The meetup will be trilingual with a few spots per organizing chapter.

Come join us!

########
Schedule
########
Greetings
Panel discussion with
Janani Ravi (East Lansing)
Jonelle Villar (Bergen)
Haifa Ben Messaoud (Tunis)
Beatriz Milz (São Paulo)
Zulemma Bazurto Blacio (Guayaquil)
Pre-prepared questions
Questions from the audience
See you soon at useR!

###################
Co-organizing chapters
###################
R-Ladies+ Vitória
R-Ladies+ Bangalore
R-Ladies+ Tunis
R-Ladies+ East Lansing
R-Ladies+ Guayaquil
R-Ladies+ Santa Rosa
R-Ladies+ Cuernavaca
R-Ladies+ Den Bosch

title: Boook club “Hands-On Machine Learning with R” - Chp11 Random Forests
description:
Join us for our new online boookclub session discussing **‘Hands-On Machine Learning with R**’ by Bradley Boehmke and Brandon Greenwell! On Monday December 5, we will talk about Chapter 11 - Random Forests.

We learned about decision trees in the previous session. But why settle for one decision tree when you can have a whole forest of them? :D Random forests are a modification of bagging. They have more predictive power than single decision trees and suffer less from tree correlation than bagging.

Our presenter is **Oussama Zidi**, a biostatistician and project manager at Urgo corporation (a wound healing specialist). He primarily uses SAS and R for stats and machine learning; and python for building apps. He has a graduate degree in applied mathematics from the University of Burgundy, France.

**This boook club:**
For this boook club we - the Den Bosch and Utrecht chapters of R Ladies - are joining forces. We will alternate hosting the meetups. In +- 10 meetings (probably more :) ) , we will work through all the chapters in the book together. We are doing this boookclub, because we like to learn together. It is not the case presenters are the experts on the matter. To make this a group effort, the idea is that all participants take turns in presenting chapters, as for example Marianna presented chapter 6, and Elena chapter 7 and 8! We are of course available to help. If you’re not comfortable presenting, just listening is also okay.
If you cannot make it this time, feel free to join in on one of the subsequent meetings.

**For who:**

* People who want to take their first steps into machine learning
* Some prior knowledge on R programming will be helpful. As the authors of the book themselves mention: “This book is not meant to be an introduction to R or to programming in general; as we assume the reader has familiarity with the R language to include defining functions, managing R objects, controlling the flow of a program, and other basic tasks.”

**What to expect:**

* Presentations summarising the key points on each topic of the book
* Putting the theory to practice by going through exercises together
* Room to discuss questions and other thoughts

**Whereabouts**:

* Meet every 2 weeks via Zoom. The password will be sent to you via e-mail before the meeting.
* We meet every second Monday, from 7 - 8.30 pm
* It is not necessary to read the chapters in advance, but feel free to do so.

R-Ladies is dedicated to providing a harassment-free experience for everyone. We do not tolerate harassment of participants in any form. See the [code of conduct](https://rladies.org/code-of-conduct/).
The book can be found at [https://bradleyboehmke.github.io/HOML/](https://bradleyboehmke.github.io/HOML/). It is also available in print. For the slides of our previous meetings, see [https://github.com/rladiesnl/book_club_handsonML](https://github.com/rladiesnl/book_club_handsonML).

title: Boook club “Hands-On Machine Learning with R” #5 - Chp7 Splines - Chp 8 KNN
description:
Join us for the FIFTH meetup for the online boookclub discussing **‘Hands-On Machine Learning with R**’ by Bradley Boehmke and Brandon Greenwell. On Monday November 7, we discuss Chapter 7 Multivariate Adaptive Regression Splines and Chapter 8 K-Nearest Neighbors.

Multivariate adaptive regression splines (MARS) is an algorithm that automatically creates a piecewise linear model. The KNN algorithm identifies the k observations most similar to a new value and then uses the average response value (regression) or the most common class (classification) of those k observations as the predicted output for the new value.

These topics will be presented by Elena Dudukina, from the R-Ladies community :). Elena is a clinical specialist and a PhD candidate (awaiting defense) at the Department of Clinical Epidemiology, Aarhus University and Aarhus University Hospital. She is interested in pharmacoepidemiology, especially drug utilization and safety in pregnancy, women’s health and she is also passionate about causal inference methods and R.

**This boook club:**
For this boook club we - the Den Bosch and Utrecht chapters of R Ladies - are joining forces. We will alternate hosting the meetups. In +- 10 meetings (probably more :) ) , we will work through all the chapters in the book together. We are doing this boookclub, because we like to learn together. To make this a group effort, the idea is that all participants take turns in presenting chapters, as for example Marianna presented chapter 6, and Elena chapter 7 and 8! If you cannot make it this time, feel free to join in on one of the subsequent meetings.

**For who:**

**What to expect:**

title: Boook club "Hands-On Machine Learning with R" - First meeting!
description:
**Details**
Now that summer is coming to an end, we thought it would be fun to work through another book together. This time, we have chosen **‘Hands-On Machine Learning with R**’ by Bradley Boehme and Brandon Greenwell.
Nowadays you hear about machine learning all the time. This book is a nice way to get familiar with the basics of machine learning in R without going in too much detail.
For this book club we - R-Ladies Utrecht and R-Ladies Den Bosch - are joining forces. In +- 10 meetings, we will work through all the chapters in the book together. We are doing this bookclub, because we like to learn together. It is not the case presenters are the experts on the matter. To make this a group effort, the idea is that all participants take turns in presenting chapters. If you’re not comfortable presenting, just listening is also okay.
On Monday September 12, we start with the first two chapters, ‘Introduction to Machine Learning’ and ‘Modeling Process’, presented by Gerbrich from R-Ladies Utrecht. If you cannot make it the first time, feel free to join in on one of the subsequent meetings.

**For who**
\- People who want to take their first steps into machine learning
\- Some prior knowledge on R programming will be helpful\. As the authors of the book themselves mention: “This book is not meant to be an introduction to R or to programming in general; as we assume the reader has familiarity with the R language to include defining functions\, managing R objects\, controlling the flow of a program\, and other basic tasks\.”

**What to expect**
\- Presentations summarising the key points on each topic of the book
\- Putting the theory to practice by going through exercises together
\- Room to discuss questions and other thoughts

**Whereabouts**
\- Meet every 2 weeks via Zoom \[url will follow later\]\.
\- First meeting is at the 12th of September 2022\, 7 \- 8\.30 pm
\- It is not necessary to read the chapters in advance\, but feel free to do so\.
The book can be found online at [https://bradleyboehmke.github.io/HOML/](https://bradleyboehmke.github.io/HOML/) ,. It is also in print.

**Code of Conduct**
R-Ladies is dedicated to providing a harassment-free experience for everyone. We do not tolerate harassment of participants in any form. See the [code of conduct](https://rladies.org/code-of-conduct/) .

title: Boook club “Hands-On Machine Learning with R” - Chp 15 Stacked Models
description:
Join us for our new online boookclub session discussing **‘Hands-On Machine Learning with R**’ by Bradley Boehmke and Brandon Greenwell! Monday February 20, we will talk about stacked models.

From the book:
***Stacking*** involves training a new learning algorithm to combine the predictions of several base learners. First, the base learners are trained using the available training data, then a combiner or meta algorithm, called the *super learner*, is trained to make a final prediction based on the predictions of the base learners.

This chapter will be presented by one of our community members: Ece. Ece Ozler, is from Turkey. She has a graduate degree in Economics from the Koc University in Turkey and a master's in Finance from the Netherlands. She has lived in the Netherlands for almost six years now. She works for an analytics company, FI Analytics, in the banking sector. She uses R and ML to build credit scoring models; C# to build apps that use the prediction models made in R.

**This boook club:**
For this boook club we - the Den Bosch and Utrecht chapters of R Ladies - are joining forces. We will alternate hosting the meetups. In +- 10 meetings (definitely more :) ) , we will work through all the chapters in the book together. We are doing this boookclub, because we like to learn together. It is not the case presenters are the experts on the matter. To make this a group effort, the idea is that all participants take turns in presenting chapters. We are of course available to help. If you’re not comfortable presenting, just listening is also okay.
If you cannot make it this time, feel free to join in on one of the subsequent meetings.

**For who:**

* People who want to take their first steps into machine learning
* Some prior knowledge on R programming will be helpful. As the authors of the book themselves mention: “This book is not meant to be an introduction to R or to programming in general; as we assume the reader has familiarity with the R language to include defining functions, managing R objects, controlling the flow of a program, and other basic tasks.”

**What to expect:**

* Presentations summarising the key points on each topic of the book
* Putting the theory to practice by going through exercises together
* Room to discuss questions and other thoughts

**Whereabouts**:

* Meet every 2 weeks via Zoom. The password will be sent to you via e-mail before the meeting.
* We meet every second Monday, from 7 - 8.30 pm
* It is not necessary to read the chapters in advance, but feel free to do so.

R-Ladies is dedicated to providing a harassment-free experience for everyone. We do not tolerate harassment of participants in any form. See the [code of conduct](https://rladies.org/code-of-conduct/).
The book can be found at [https://bradleyboehmke.github.io/HOML/](https://bradleyboehmke.github.io/HOML/). It is also available in print. For the slides of our previous meetings, see [https://github.com/rladiesnl/book_club_handsonML](https://github.com/rladiesnl/book_club_handsonML).

title: Boook club “Hands-On Machine Learning with R” - Chp13 Deep learning
description:
Join us for our new online boookclub session discussing **‘Hands-On Machine Learning with R**’ by Bradley Boehmke and Brandon Greenwell! In the first session of the new year, on Monday January 9, we will learn all about deep learning with neural networks!

Most machine learning models are shallow models: they only use a few layers of data transformations to reach the output representation. In contrast, **deep learning** uses many layers, where every additional layer creates a more elaborate representation. This results in complex models, for example used in image classification, speech recognition and autonomous driving.

Our presenter is **Galin Bajlekov**: a big fan of neural networks, long-time R user and R-Ladies supporter. He has a lot of experience with machine learning and data science, both in and outside of academia. Currently, he is a software engineer at [Enso](https://enso.org) (https://enso.org).

**This boook club:**
For this boook club we - the Den Bosch and Utrecht chapters of R Ladies - are joining forces. We will alternate hosting the meetups. In +- 10 meetings (probably more :) ) , we will work through all the chapters in the book together. We are doing this boookclub, because we like to learn together. It is not the case presenters are the experts on the matter. To make this a group effort, the idea is that all participants take turns in presenting chapters, as for example Marianna presented chapter 6, and Elena chapter 7 and 8! We are of course available to help. If you’re not comfortable presenting, just listening is also okay.
If you cannot make it this time, feel free to join in on one of the subsequent meetings.

**For who:**

* People who want to take their first steps into machine learning
* Some prior knowledge on R programming will be helpful. As the authors of the book themselves mention: “This book is not meant to be an introduction to R or to programming in general; as we assume the reader has familiarity with the R language to include defining functions, managing R objects, controlling the flow of a program, and other basic tasks.”

**What to expect:**

* Presentations summarising the key points on each topic of the book
* Putting the theory to practice by going through exercises together
* Room to discuss questions and other thoughts

title: Boook club Happy Git and GitHub for the useR - kick-off session
description:
Interested in streamlining your workflow by connecting Git and R? Join our **book club** for “**[Happy Git and GitHub for the useR](https://happygitwithr.com/)”** by Jennifer (Jenny) Bryan! The book describes the use of the version control system Git and the hosting site GitHub for statistical and data scientific workflows in R.

After our engaging sessions on “Building Reproducible Analytical Pipelines with R” by R-Ladies Bergen and “Hands-On Machine Learning with R” by R-Ladies Den Bosch, we're excited to team up for a joint book club, together with R-Ladies Amsterdam!

Jenny Bryan herself will introduce the book and be available for questions during the kick-off session!

**When**: Kicking off on Wednesday, November 6, 2024, at 16:30 CET (Den Bosch/Bergen/Amsterdam time) – thereafter 17.00 CET every 2 weeks

**Where**: Zoom (link will be shared later)

**What to expect?**

* Book Club Format: Every two weeks, we’ll work through each chapter together. To make this a group effort, the idea is that all participants take turns in presenting chapters. Participants are encouraged to present chapter summaries, but listening in is equally welcome.
* Presentations summarizing key points from each chapter
* Open discussions for questions, insights, and collaborative learning

Feel free to join us at any session, even if you miss the first one. We’ll explore “**[Happy Git and GitHub for the useR](https://happygitwithr.com/)”** together – learning is better in good company! You do not have to prepare anything for the kick-off session.

**Code of Conduct**
R-Ladies is committed to a welcoming, harassment-free experience for everyone. We have a strict Code of Conduct and do not tolerate harassment in any form. See the [code of conduct](https://rladies.org/code-of-conduct/)

title: R package Development (in person event)
description:
Our last meetup has been a while, but that is going to change!

Our upcoming meet-up ( a joined event with RLadies Utrecht) is an actual in-person meet in Utrecht! And we have a very special guest: **Jenny Bryan** will be in the Netherlands, and offered to have a talk for us at a meet about R package development. What a wonderful opportunity to meet in person with Jenny and other R-Ladies!

Jenny will be talking about R Package development (https://r-pkgs.org/).

SURF Utrecht kindly offered to host this special occasion. SURF is a cooperative association of Dutch educational and research institutions in which the members work together to acquire or develop the best possible digital services, and to encourage knowledge sharing through continuous innovation ([https://www.surf.nl/en/about](https://www.surf.nl/en/about)). And it is very close to the main train station in Utrecht.

R-Ladies is dedicated to providing a harassment-free experience for everyone. We do not tolerate harassment of participants in any form. See the [code of conduct](https://rladies.org/code-of-conduct/).

Come join us in Utrecht!

title: Boook club Happy Git and GitHub for the useR - Sixth meeting
description:
Join us for the sixth meetup for the online boook club discussing **‘Happy Git and Github for the useR**’ by Jenny Bryan. On Tuesday February 18, we discuss the part **Daily workflows part 2**, presented by Josefina from R-Ladies Amsterdam.

For this boook club we - the Bergen, Den Bosch and Amsterdam chapters of R Ladies - are joining forces. In a couple of meetings, we will work through all the chapters in the book together. We are doing this boook club, because we like to learn together. It is not the case presenters are necessarily the experts on the matter. To make this a group effort, the idea is that all participants take turns in presenting chapters. If you’re not comfortable presenting, just listening is also okay.

If you cannot make it this time, feel free to join in on one of the subsequent meetings. And / Or have a look at the [slides](https://github.com/rladiesboookclub/happygitwithr).

R-Ladies is dedicated to providing a harassment-free experience for everyone. We do not tolerate harassment of participants in any form. See the [code of conduct](https://rladies.org/coc/).

The book can be found at [https://happygitwithr.com](https://happygitwithr.com), previous presentations of the boook club at [our repo on github](https://github.com/rladiesboookclub/happygitwithr).

title: Boook club Happy Git and GitHub for the useR - Fourth meeting
description:
